name: CIS Controls v8
description: CIS Critical Security Controls v8 - a prioritized set of actions to protect organizations and data from known cyber attack vectors.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain Detailed Enterprise Asset Inventory
Establish and Maintain a Software Inventory
Establish and Maintain a Data Management Process
Establish and Maintain a Secure Configuration Process
Establish and Maintain an Asset Management Process
Establish and Maintain an Access Control Process
Establish and Maintain an Audit Log Management Process

checklists.title: Security Infrastructure
checklists.description: Infrastructure security hardening and configuration assessment based on CIS Benchmarks and NIST SP 800-53

items.question: Are all firewalls configured with deny-by-default rules and reviewed quarterly?
items.autoTaskTitle: Configure deny-by-default firewall rules and schedule quarterly review

items.question: Is an IDS/IPS deployed and actively monitored on all critical network segments?
items.autoTaskTitle: Deploy and configure IDS/IPS on critical network segments

items.question: Is network segmentation enforced between production, staging, and development environments?
items.autoTaskTitle: Implement network segmentation between environments

items.question: Are critical and high-severity patches applied within SLA (14 days critical, 30 days high)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Establish and enforce patch management SLA

items.question: Are all servers hardened according to CIS Benchmarks?
items.expectedEvidence: CIS benchmark scan report for all server categories
items.autoTaskTitle: Apply CIS benchmark hardening configurations

items.question: Are TLS certificates valid, using TLS 1.2+ only, and auto-renewed?
items.autoTaskTitle: Upgrade TLS configuration and enable auto-renewal

items.question: Is SSH access restricted to key-based authentication with keys rotated every 90 days?
items.autoTaskTitle: Enforce SSH key-based auth and configure rotation

items.question: Are unused services, ports, and protocols disabled on all servers?
items.autoTaskTitle: Disable unused services and ports

items.question: Is anti-malware deployed and updated on all infrastructure components?
items.autoTaskTitle: Deploy anti-malware on all infrastructure

items.question: Are system clocks synchronized via NTP with authenticated time sources?
items.autoTaskTitle: Configure NTP synchronization across infrastructure

checklists.title: Security Cluster
checklists.description: Kubernetes/container orchestration security based on CIS Kubernetes Benchmark and NSA Kubernetes Hardening Guide

items.question: Is Kubernetes RBAC enabled and properly configured (no cluster-admin for workloads)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Configure Kubernetes RBAC with least privilege

items.question: Are Network Policies enforced to restrict pod-to-pod communication?
items.autoTaskTitle: Implement Kubernetes Network Policies

items.question: Are Pod Security Standards (Restricted) enforced on all namespaces?
items.autoTaskTitle: Enforce Pod Security Standards (Restricted profile)

items.question: Are containers running as non-root with read-only root filesystem?
items.autoTaskTitle: Configure non-root containers with read-only filesystem

items.question: Is the Kubernetes API server access restricted and audited?
items.autoTaskTitle: Restrict and audit Kubernetes API server access

items.question: Are secrets encrypted at rest in etcd?
items.autoTaskTitle: Enable etcd encryption at rest for secrets

items.question: Is admission control (OPA Gatekeeper / Kyverno) deployed and enforcing policies?
items.autoTaskTitle: Deploy admission controller with security policies

items.question: Are container runtime security monitoring tools deployed (Falco, Sysdig)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Deploy container runtime security monitoring

items.question: Is the container image registry private with vulnerability scanning enabled?
items.autoTaskTitle: Configure private registry with image scanning

items.question: Kubernetes CIS Benchmark compliance score
items.expectedEvidence: kube-bench or equivalent scan report

checklists.title: Infrastructure - CIS Controls v8 & Benchmarks
checklists.description: Security assessment checklist based on the Center for Internet Security (CIS) Controls Version 8 and associated CIS Benchmarks for infrastructure environments. Covers enterprise asset inventory (Control 1), software asset inventory (Control 2), data protection (Control 3), secure configuration (Control 4), account management (Control 5), access control management (Control 6), continuous vulnerability management (Control 7), audit log management (Control 8), email and web browser protections (Control 9), malware defenses (Control 10), data recovery (Control 11), network infrastructure management (Control 12), network monitoring and defense (Control 13), security awareness training (Control 14), application software security (Control 16), and penetration testing (Control 18). Each item maps to a specific CIS Controls v8 safeguard for actionable infrastructure hardening.

items.question: Is an actively managed inventory of all enterprise assets (hardware, virtual machines, cloud instances, IoT devices) maintained, with each asset assigned an owner, and is the inventory updated at least weekly through automated discovery scans (CIS Controls v8 1.1)?
items.expectedEvidence: Asset inventory export from CMDB or discovery tool showing asset name, IP, owner, classification, and last-seen timestamp.
items.autoTaskTitle: Validate enterprise asset inventory completeness (CIS 1.1)

items.question: Are unauthorized assets detected and addressed within a defined timeframe, either by removing them from the network, quarantining them, or adding them to the approved inventory with proper authorization (CIS Controls v8 1.2)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify unauthorized asset detection and remediation process (CIS 1.2)

items.question: Is a detailed software inventory maintained for all infrastructure systems, including operating systems, firmware versions, installed applications, and libraries, and is it updated through automated scanning at least every two weeks (CIS Controls v8 2.1)?
items.expectedEvidence: Software inventory report from endpoint management or scanning tool showing software name, version, and host for each infrastructure system.
items.autoTaskTitle: Review software asset inventory for infrastructure systems (CIS 2.1)

items.question: Are only authorized software applications allowed to execute on infrastructure systems through application whitelisting, software restriction policies, or equivalent technical controls (CIS Controls v8 2.5)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify application whitelisting on infrastructure servers (CIS 2.5)

items.question: Is a data classification scheme applied to data stored and processed on infrastructure systems, and are technical controls (encryption, access restrictions) aligned to the sensitivity classification of each data type (CIS Controls v8 3.7)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Evaluate data classification and protection on infrastructure (CIS 3.7)

items.question: Are secure configuration baselines established and enforced for all infrastructure asset types (servers, network devices, hypervisors, storage), using industry-recognized hardening guides such as CIS Benchmarks or vendor security guides (CIS Controls v8 4.1)?
items.expectedEvidence: Secure baseline configuration templates for each infrastructure type, compliance scan results showing adherence to CIS Benchmarks or equivalent standards.
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify secure configuration baselines for infrastructure (CIS 4.1)

items.question: Are default credentials on all infrastructure assets changed before deployment, and is this verified through automated scanning or a documented verification checklist (CIS Controls v8 4.7)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Check for default credentials on infrastructure devices (CIS 4.7)

items.question: Is a centralized account management process used for all infrastructure systems, including procedures for provisioning, modification, disabling, and deprovisioning of user and service accounts (CIS Controls v8 5.1)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Assess centralized account management for infrastructure (CIS 5.1)

items.question: Are all administrative accounts on infrastructure systems inventoried, and is the list reviewed at least quarterly to disable or remove accounts that are no longer needed or associated with terminated personnel (CIS Controls v8 5.3)?
items.expectedEvidence: List of all administrative accounts per infrastructure system with last-review date, and evidence of removal/disabling of stale accounts.
items.autoTaskTitle: Review administrative account inventory and cleanup (CIS 5.3)

items.question: Is role-based access control (RBAC) implemented across infrastructure management systems, and are access rights assigned based on job function rather than individual permissions (CIS Controls v8 6.8)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Evaluate role-based access control implementation on infrastructure (CIS 6.8)

items.question: Are automated vulnerability scans performed against all infrastructure assets at least monthly, covering operating systems, installed software, and firmware, with results triaged and remediated based on risk severity within defined SLAs (CIS Controls v8 7.1, 7.4)?
items.expectedEvidence: Recent vulnerability scan reports, remediation SLA definitions, and tracking data showing patch/remediation timelines for critical, high, and medium findings.
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify continuous vulnerability scanning and remediation (CIS 7.1/7.4)

items.question: Is audit logging enabled on all infrastructure systems, collecting logs for authentication events, privilege changes, configuration modifications, and system errors, and are logs forwarded to a centralized log management system (CIS Controls v8 8.2, 8.9)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify centralized audit log collection for infrastructure (CIS 8.2/8.9)

items.question: Are audit logs retained for a minimum period consistent with organizational policy and regulatory requirements (e.g., 90 days online, 1 year archived), and are logs protected from unauthorized modification or deletion (CIS Controls v8 8.10)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Check audit log retention and integrity protection (CIS 8.10)

items.question: Are DNS filtering and web proxy controls deployed to restrict infrastructure management systems from accessing known malicious domains, and are only approved browsers with security extensions permitted on admin workstations (CIS Controls v8 9.2)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify DNS filtering and browser security on admin workstations (CIS 9.2)

items.question: Is anti-malware software deployed and configured for automatic updates and real-time scanning on all infrastructure endpoints (servers, hypervisors, admin workstations), and are scans configured to cover memory, boot records, and all attached storage (CIS Controls v8 10.1, 10.2)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify anti-malware deployment and configuration on infrastructure (CIS 10.1/10.2)

items.question: Are automated backups performed for all infrastructure system configurations, critical data, and key management material, and are backup restoration procedures tested at least quarterly to ensure recoverability within the defined RTO (CIS Controls v8 11.1, 11.2, 11.4)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Evaluate backup and recovery testing for infrastructure (CIS 11.1/11.2/11.4)

items.question: Is the network infrastructure securely managed, including use of encrypted management protocols (SSH, HTTPS, SNMPv3), up-to-date firmware on all network devices, and documented network architecture diagrams that are reviewed at least annually (CIS Controls v8 12.1)?
items.expectedEvidence: Network device firmware version inventory, management protocol configuration evidence (SSH, SNMPv3), and current network architecture diagrams with last-review date.
items.autoTaskTitle: Review network infrastructure management practices (CIS 12.1)

items.question: Are network intrusion detection/prevention systems (IDS/IPS) deployed at key network boundaries and monitored continuously, with signatures and behavioral rules updated regularly and alerts investigated within defined response times (CIS Controls v8 13.3)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Assess network IDS/IPS deployment and monitoring (CIS 13.3)

items.question: Do infrastructure administrators receive role-specific security training covering secure configuration, incident response procedures, common attack techniques against infrastructure, and social engineering awareness, at least annually (CIS Controls v8 14.9)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify infrastructure admin security training program (CIS 14.9)

items.question: Are infrastructure management applications (orchestration tools, monitoring platforms, automation scripts) assessed for security vulnerabilities and updated with security patches in a timely manner (CIS Controls v8 16.4)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Evaluate security patching for infrastructure management applications (CIS 16.4)

items.question: Are penetration tests conducted against infrastructure systems at least annually, covering both external-facing and internal infrastructure, with identified vulnerabilities prioritized and remediated within defined timelines (CIS Controls v8 18.1, 18.3)?
items.expectedEvidence: Most recent penetration test report with scope, findings, risk ratings, and evidence of remediation tracking for identified vulnerabilities.
items.autoTaskTitle: Review penetration testing program for infrastructure (CIS 18.1/18.3)

checklists.title: Pipeline - CIS Software Supply Chain Security
checklists.description: Security checklist based on the CIS Software Supply Chain Security Guide covering end-to-end supply chain protections. Addresses source code integrity measures including commit signing, branch protection, and code review enforcement. Covers build pipeline security including build environment hardening, build reproducibility, and provenance generation. Includes dependency management controls for vulnerability scanning, license compliance, and supply chain attack prevention. Addresses artifact security through signing, storage, and distribution controls. Concludes with deployment security covering promotion gates, environment integrity, and runtime verification.

items.question: Are all commits to protected branches required to be cryptographically signed (GPG or SSH signatures) to ensure author identity and prevent commit impersonation?
items.autoTaskTitle: Auto-check commit signing enforcement on protected branches

items.question: Are branch protection rules configured on all release and main branches to require pull request reviews, status checks, and prevent force pushes, ensuring source code changes are controlled and traceable?
items.expectedEvidence: Branch protection configuration export showing required reviewers (minimum 2), required status checks, force push restrictions, and admin enforcement settings.
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify branch protection rules on release branches

items.question: Is there a defined code ownership model (e.g., CODEOWNERS file) that automatically assigns reviewers based on the files modified, ensuring domain experts review changes to sensitive code areas?
items.autoTaskTitle: Confirm code ownership model and automatic reviewer assignment

items.question: Are repository access permissions configured following the principle of least privilege, with write access restricted to authorized contributors and admin access limited to repository maintainers?
items.autoTaskTitle: Assess repository access control adherence to least privilege

items.question: Is the build environment hardened with a minimal set of installed tools, network restrictions preventing egress to untrusted endpoints, and no persistent storage that carries over between builds?
items.autoTaskTitle: Assess build environment hardening controls

items.question: Are build pipeline credentials (service accounts, API tokens, deploy keys) scoped to the minimum permissions required, with separate credentials for each pipeline stage and no shared credentials across projects?
items.expectedEvidence: Inventory of pipeline service accounts and tokens with their assigned permissions, demonstrating minimal scope and per-stage separation.
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify pipeline credentials follow least privilege principle

items.question: Does the build pipeline generate and attach Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) to every produced artifact, in a standard format (SPDX or CycloneDX)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Confirm SBOM generation for all build artifacts

items.question: Is build provenance automatically generated and attached to artifacts, containing the build platform identity, source reference, build parameters, and all dependency inputs?
items.expectedEvidence: Sample provenance attestation (in-toto, SLSA provenance format) attached to a recent build artifact, showing builder ID, source digest, entry point, and resolved dependencies.
items.autoTaskTitle: Validate build provenance generation and attachment to artifacts

items.question: Are all dependencies pinned to exact versions with cryptographic hash verification (lock files with integrity hashes) to prevent dependency confusion, typosquatting, and unauthorized version substitution?
items.autoTaskTitle: Auto-check dependencies are pinned with integrity hashes

items.question: Is automated dependency vulnerability scanning (SCA) integrated into the pipeline, blocking builds when critical or high severity vulnerabilities are detected in direct or transitive dependencies?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify dependency vulnerability scanning blocks builds on critical CVEs

items.question: Is there a private registry or proxy (e.g., Artifactory, Nexus, npm private registry) configured as the sole source for dependencies, preventing direct pulls from public registries and enabling centralized vulnerability scanning and caching?
items.expectedEvidence: Private registry or proxy configuration, network rules blocking direct public registry access from build environments, and dependency resolution configuration pointing to the private registry.
items.autoTaskTitle: Validate private registry or proxy is enforced for dependencies

items.question: Are dependency license compliance checks performed as part of the pipeline to identify and flag dependencies with copyleft, restrictive, or unknown licenses that could pose legal or compliance risks?
items.autoTaskTitle: Confirm dependency license compliance scanning in pipeline

items.question: Are all produced artifacts (container images, packages, binaries) signed using keyless (Sigstore/Fulcio) or key-based signing before being pushed to the artifact registry?
items.expectedEvidence: Artifact signing pipeline step configuration, sample signed artifact with verification proof, and key management or Sigstore OIDC configuration documentation.
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify all artifacts are signed before registry publication

items.question: Are artifact registries configured with access controls, vulnerability scanning, and immutability policies that prevent overwriting of published artifact versions (tag immutability)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Assess artifact registry security and immutability configuration

items.question: Is there an artifact retention and lifecycle policy that defines how long artifacts are retained, when they are promoted or deprecated, and how end-of-life artifacts are securely purged?
items.autoTaskTitle: Confirm artifact retention and lifecycle policy exists

items.question: Are deployment pipelines configured to verify artifact signatures and provenance attestations before deploying to any environment, rejecting artifacts that fail verification?
items.autoTaskTitle: Auto-check artifact verification is enforced before deployment

items.question: Is there a promotion model that ensures artifacts are deployed through each environment stage (dev, staging, production) in order, with security gates at each promotion boundary preventing stage skipping?
items.expectedEvidence: Pipeline configuration showing sequential environment promotion with gates, and evidence that direct-to-production deployments are blocked by policy.
items.autoTaskTitle: Validate environment promotion model with security gates

items.question: Are runtime admission controllers (e.g., Kyverno, OPA Gatekeeper, Kubernetes admission webhooks) configured to enforce that only signed and verified artifacts from trusted registries can be deployed to production?
items.expectedEvidence: Admission controller policies and configuration showing trusted registry allowlists, signature verification requirements, and deny-by-default rules for unsigned images.
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify runtime admission controls for artifact trust enforcement

checklists.title: Network - CIS Controls v8 Network Security
checklists.description: Security checklist based on CIS Controls v8 for network security. Covers CIS Control 9 (Email and Web Browser Protections), Control 12 (Network Infrastructure Management), Control 13 (Network Monitoring and Defense), firewall rule management, IDS/IPS deployment, network segmentation, VLAN configuration, DNS security, DNSSEC implementation, WAF deployment, DDoS protection, VPN/SASE architecture, mTLS enforcement, and certificate management. This checklist ensures network assets are assessed against CIS Controls v8 best practices.

items.question: Are only fully supported browsers and email clients allowed to execute in the organization, and are unsupported versions blocked from network access (CIS Control 9.1)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify browser and email client version enforcement on the network

items.question: Are DNS filtering services used to block access to known malicious domains and content categories that violate enterprise policy (CIS Control 9.2)?
items.expectedEvidence: DNS filtering service configuration showing blocked categories, malicious domain block lists, and sample DNS query logs demonstrating enforcement.
items.autoTaskTitle: Validate DNS filtering service deployment and configuration

items.question: Is a network-based URL filter deployed to limit connections to known malicious or unapproved websites, and is it configured to log all URL requests for monitoring purposes (CIS Control 9.3)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify network-based URL filtering deployment

items.question: Is the network infrastructure kept up-to-date, with firmware and software on routers, switches, firewalls, and other network devices updated to the latest stable, vendor-supported versions (CIS Control 12.1)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Assess network infrastructure firmware and software currency

items.question: Is a secure network architecture established and maintained with up-to-date network diagrams that document data flows, trust boundaries, and security zones (CIS Control 12.2)?
items.expectedEvidence: Current network architecture diagrams with timestamps, showing data flows, trust boundaries, security zones, and last-reviewed date.
items.autoTaskTitle: Validate network architecture documentation and diagrams

items.question: Are all network infrastructure devices managed securely, with default credentials changed, unnecessary services disabled, and management interfaces accessible only from dedicated management networks (CIS Control 12.3)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify secure management configuration of network devices

items.question: Are all remote management sessions for network infrastructure devices encrypted using protocols such as SSH, HTTPS, or TLS, and are unencrypted protocols (Telnet, HTTP, SNMPv1/v2) disabled (CIS Control 12.6)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify encrypted remote management for network devices

items.question: Are network intrusion detection/prevention systems (IDS/IPS) deployed at critical network boundaries and configured with up-to-date signature sets and behavioral rules (CIS Control 13.2)?
items.expectedEvidence: IDS/IPS deployment topology, current signature version documentation, and sample alert reports from the past 30 days.
items.autoTaskTitle: Validate IDS/IPS deployment and signature currency

items.question: Is network traffic filtered between network segments to restrict traffic to only the services and protocols that are explicitly required for business operations (CIS Control 13.4)?
items.expectedEvidence: Firewall rule sets or ACLs governing inter-segment traffic, with documented business justification for each allowed rule.
items.autoTaskTitle: Review network segmentation firewall rules and justifications

items.question: Is NetFlow or equivalent network flow data collected, retained, and analyzed to detect anomalous traffic patterns and potential security incidents (CIS Control 13.6)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Assess network flow data collection and analysis capabilities

items.question: Are firewall rules reviewed at least quarterly to remove stale, overly permissive, or conflicting rules, with a documented change management process for all firewall modifications?
items.expectedEvidence: Firewall rule review reports from the last two quarters, change request tickets, and rule cleanup records.
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify quarterly firewall rule review process

items.question: Are VLANs configured to logically segment the network based on function, data sensitivity, and trust level, with inter-VLAN routing controlled by firewall or ACL policies?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify VLAN segmentation and inter-VLAN access controls

items.question: Is DNSSEC enabled for all externally facing domains to prevent DNS spoofing and cache poisoning attacks, and are DNSSEC validation checks performed on recursive resolvers?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify DNSSEC deployment and validation on DNS resolvers

items.question: Are internal DNS servers hardened, configured with response rate limiting, and monitored for DNS tunneling and exfiltration attempts?
items.autoTaskTitle: Assess internal DNS server hardening and monitoring

items.question: Is a Web Application Firewall (WAF) deployed in front of all internet-facing web applications, configured with OWASP Top 10 rulesets, and tuned to minimize false positives?
items.expectedEvidence: WAF deployment configuration, enabled rule sets, tuning records, and sample blocked request logs.
items.autoTaskTitle: Validate WAF deployment and OWASP ruleset configuration

items.question: Is DDoS protection deployed at the network edge, including volumetric, protocol, and application-layer attack mitigation, with documented escalation procedures and SLAs with the DDoS mitigation provider?
items.expectedEvidence: DDoS protection service agreement, mitigation capacity documentation, runbook for DDoS response, and results from the most recent DDoS simulation test.
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify DDoS protection deployment and response procedures

items.question: Is remote network access provided through a VPN or SASE solution that enforces strong authentication (MFA), encrypts all traffic, and applies zero-trust access policies based on user identity and device posture?
items.autoTaskTitle: Assess VPN/SASE deployment with MFA and zero-trust policies

items.question: Is mutual TLS (mTLS) enforced for all service-to-service communication within the network, ensuring both client and server identities are cryptographically verified?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify mTLS enforcement for service-to-service communications

items.question: Is a centralized certificate management system deployed to track all TLS/SSL certificates across the network, with automated alerts for expiring certificates at least 30 days before expiration?
items.expectedEvidence: Certificate inventory report from the certificate management platform, expiration alert configuration, and evidence of certificate renewal workflow.
items.autoTaskTitle: Validate centralized certificate management and expiration alerting

items.question: Are certificate authorities (CAs) used for internal PKI properly secured, with root CA keys stored in hardware security modules (HSMs) and intermediate CAs used for day-to-day issuance?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify internal PKI CA security and HSM key storage

checklists.title: Tool - CIS Controls v8 Security Operations
checklists.description: Security checklist based on CIS Controls v8 for security operations tooling. Covers CIS Control 7 (Continuous Vulnerability Management), Control 8 (Audit Log Management), Control 10 (Malware Defenses), Control 13 (Network Monitoring and Defense), Control 16 (Application Software Security), Control 17 (Incident Response Management), Control 18 (Penetration Testing), EDR deployment, SOC operations, SOAR automation, and threat hunting capabilities. This checklist ensures security operations tools and processes are assessed against CIS Controls v8 best practices.

items.question: Is an enterprise vulnerability management tool deployed that performs automated vulnerability scanning of all enterprise assets on a recurring schedule, with credentialed scanning enabled for comprehensive coverage (CIS Control 7.1, 7.4)?
items.expectedEvidence: Vulnerability scanner deployment documentation, scan schedule configuration, credentialed scan settings, and asset coverage percentage report.
items.autoTaskTitle: Validate vulnerability management tool deployment and scanning coverage

items.question: Is a risk-based remediation process established for vulnerabilities discovered by scanning tools, prioritizing remediation based on exploitability, asset criticality, and threat intelligence context (CIS Control 7.2, 7.4)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Assess risk-based vulnerability remediation process and prioritization

items.question: Is a centralized log management tool deployed to collect, aggregate, and retain audit logs from all enterprise assets and software, with standardized log formats and timestamp synchronization via NTP (CIS Control 8.2, 8.4)?
items.expectedEvidence: Log management platform architecture, log source inventory, NTP synchronization configuration, and retention policy documentation.
items.autoTaskTitle: Validate centralized log management deployment and configuration

items.question: Are audit logs protected from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion through access controls, immutable storage, or forwarding to a write-once repository (CIS Control 8.3)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify audit log integrity protections and access controls

items.question: Are detailed audit logs collected for sensitive actions including command-line activity, DNS queries, email metadata, URL requests, and authentication events (CIS Control 8.5, 8.6, 8.7, 8.8, 8.11)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Assess detailed audit log collection for sensitive activities

items.question: Is anti-malware software deployed and centrally managed on all enterprise assets, with automatic signature updates, behavioral detection capabilities, and centralized alerting enabled (CIS Control 10.1, 10.2)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify anti-malware deployment coverage and central management

items.question: Is automatic scanning of removable media configured on endpoints, and are anti-exploitation features (DEP, ASLR, EMET) enabled on all supported systems (CIS Control 10.4, 10.5)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify removable media scanning and anti-exploitation features

items.question: Are network monitoring tools deployed to detect and alert on anomalous network behavior at network boundaries and key internal segments, using both signature-based and behavioral detection methods (CIS Control 13.1, 13.2)?
items.expectedEvidence: Network monitoring tool deployment topology, detection method configuration (signature and behavioral), and sample alert reports from the past 30 days.
items.autoTaskTitle: Validate network monitoring tool deployment and detection methods

items.question: Are application security testing tools (SAST, DAST, SCA) deployed and integrated into the software development lifecycle to identify vulnerabilities before code reaches production (CIS Control 16.4, 16.5, 16.6)?
items.expectedEvidence: Application security tool inventory (SAST, DAST, SCA), CI/CD pipeline integration configuration, and sample scan results with remediation tracking.
items.autoTaskTitle: Validate application security testing tool integration in SDLC

items.question: Are incident response tools (case management, forensic analysis, communication platforms) deployed and operational, with documented procedures for their use during security incidents (CIS Control 17.4)?
items.expectedEvidence: Incident response tool inventory, operational runbooks for each tool, and evidence from the most recent incident response exercise or actual incident.
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify incident response tool readiness and operational documentation

items.question: Are incident response procedures tested through tabletop exercises or simulations at least annually, with lessons learned incorporated into tool configurations and playbook updates (CIS Control 17.7, 17.8)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify annual incident response testing and lessons learned process

items.question: Is a penetration testing program established using appropriate tools and methodologies, with tests conducted at least annually on external and internal network boundaries and critical applications (CIS Control 18.1, 18.2)?
items.expectedEvidence: Penetration testing policy, scope documentation, most recent test reports (external and internal), and remediation tracking for identified findings.
items.autoTaskTitle: Validate penetration testing program and recent test results

items.question: Is an Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) solution deployed on all endpoints and servers, providing real-time threat detection, automated containment, forensic data collection, and integration with the SIEM platform?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify EDR deployment coverage and SIEM integration

items.question: Is a Security Operations Center (SOC) established with defined operating hours (24x7 or risk-justified coverage), staffing levels, escalation procedures, and performance metrics (MTTD, MTTR)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Assess SOC operational maturity and performance metrics

items.question: Is a Security Orchestration, Automation, and Response (SOAR) platform deployed to automate repetitive security operations tasks such as alert triage, indicator enrichment, containment actions, and playbook execution?
items.autoTaskTitle: Assess SOAR platform deployment and automation coverage

items.question: Are SOAR playbooks documented, version-controlled, and tested regularly, covering the most common incident types (phishing, malware, unauthorized access, data exfiltration) with defined response actions?
items.expectedEvidence: SOAR playbook inventory, version control repository, test execution logs, and coverage mapping to common incident types.
items.autoTaskTitle: Validate SOAR playbook documentation and testing

items.question: Is a threat hunting program established with dedicated or assigned personnel who proactively search for indicators of compromise and adversary activity using hypothesis-driven methodologies and threat intelligence?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify threat hunting program establishment and methodology

items.question: Are threat hunting findings documented, shared with the detection engineering team, and used to create new detection rules in the SIEM and EDR platforms to improve future automated detection capabilities?
items.expectedEvidence: Threat hunting reports, new detection rules created from hunting findings, and feedback loop documentation between hunting and detection engineering teams.
items.autoTaskTitle: Validate threat hunting to detection engineering feedback loop

checklists.title: Cluster - CIS Kubernetes Benchmark v1.8
checklists.description: Comprehensive security checklist based on the CIS Kubernetes Benchmark v1.8 covering all major control sections. Includes API Server configuration and security settings (Section 1), etcd node configuration for data-at-rest protection (Section 2), Controller Manager and Scheduler settings (Section 3), Worker Node security including kubelet configuration (Section 4), and Kubernetes security policies covering RBAC (5.1), Pod Security Standards (5.2), Network Policies (5.3), Secrets Management (5.4), and General Policies (5.7). This checklist ensures Kubernetes clusters are hardened according to industry-recognized best practices to protect against unauthorized access, privilege escalation, data exfiltration, and lateral movement.

items.question: Is anonymous authentication disabled on the Kubernetes API server by setting --anonymous-auth=false, preventing unauthenticated access to the API (CIS 1.1.1)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Auto-check anonymous authentication is disabled on API server

items.question: Is the --insecure-port flag set to 0 (or the insecure port disabled entirely) on the API server, ensuring all API traffic is served over TLS-encrypted connections (CIS 1.1.2)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Auto-check API server insecure port is disabled

items.question: Is the --profiling flag set to false on the API server, disabling profiling endpoints that could expose sensitive runtime information to attackers (CIS 1.1.3)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify API server profiling is disabled

items.question: Are appropriate admission controllers enabled on the API server (NodeRestriction, PodSecurity, AlwaysPullImages, ResourceQuota, LimitRanger, NetworkPolicy) while dangerous ones (AlwaysAdmit) are disabled (CIS 1.2.1)?
items.expectedEvidence: API server configuration or manifest showing the --enable-admission-plugins flag with the list of enabled admission controllers, and confirmation AlwaysAdmit is not present.
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify admission controller configuration on API server

items.question: Is audit logging enabled on the API server with a comprehensive audit policy that captures authentication, authorization, and resource modification events at the RequestResponse level for sensitive resources (CIS 1.2.2)?
items.expectedEvidence: Audit policy YAML file showing logging levels per resource type, --audit-log-path and --audit-policy-file flags in API server configuration, and sample audit log entries.
items.autoTaskTitle: Validate API server audit logging configuration

items.question: Is the API server configured with TLS 1.2 or higher (--tls-min-version=VersionTLS12) and strong cipher suites, with weak ciphers explicitly excluded (CIS 1.2.3)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Auto-check API server TLS version and cipher suite configuration

items.question: Are API server authentication mechanisms properly configured, with at minimum OIDC-based authentication for human users and service account tokens for workloads, and are static token files and basic auth disabled (CIS 1.2.4)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Assess API server authentication mechanism configuration

items.question: Is etcd configured with client certificate authentication (--client-cert-auth=true) and TLS encryption for all client connections (--cert-file, --key-file), preventing unauthorized access to the cluster data store (CIS 2.1)?
items.expectedEvidence: Etcd configuration file or command-line flags showing --client-cert-auth=true, --cert-file, --key-file, and --trusted-ca-file settings.
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify etcd client certificate authentication and TLS

items.question: Is etcd peer communication encrypted using TLS with mutual authentication (--peer-cert-file, --peer-key-file, --peer-client-cert-auth=true) to prevent eavesdropping and man-in-the-middle attacks between etcd cluster members (CIS 2.2)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Auto-check etcd peer communication TLS and mutual authentication

items.question: Is etcd data encryption at rest enabled using a properly configured EncryptionConfiguration resource, encrypting Secrets and other sensitive resources stored in etcd (CIS 2.3)?
items.expectedEvidence: EncryptionConfiguration YAML showing encryption providers (aescbc, aesgcm, kms) for secrets resources, and API server --encryption-provider-config flag pointing to the configuration.
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify etcd data encryption at rest configuration

items.question: Is the Controller Manager configured with --use-service-account-credentials=true to use individual service account credentials for each controller, limiting the blast radius if any single controller is compromised (CIS 3.1)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify Controller Manager uses per-controller service accounts

items.question: Is the Controller Manager configured to rotate kubelet serving certificates automatically (--rotate-kubelet-serving-certificates=true) and is the certificate rotation threshold set appropriately (CIS 3.2)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Auto-check kubelet serving certificate rotation configuration

items.question: Is the kubelet configured with authentication enabled (--anonymous-auth=false) and authorization mode set to Webhook, ensuring all requests to the kubelet API are authenticated and authorized by the API server (CIS 4.1)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Auto-check kubelet authentication and authorization configuration

items.question: Are kubelet configuration files and certificates protected with appropriate file permissions (600 or 644 for config, 600 for keys) and owned by root, preventing unauthorized reading or modification (CIS 4.2)?
items.expectedEvidence: Output of file permission checks on kubelet configuration files (/var/lib/kubelet/config.yaml, /etc/kubernetes/kubelet.conf) and certificate files showing correct ownership and permissions.
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify kubelet file permissions and ownership

items.question: Is the kubelet configured to enforce read-only access to the kubelet read-only port by setting --read-only-port=0, disabling unauthenticated health and metrics endpoints (CIS 4.3)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify kubelet read-only port is disabled

items.question: Are RBAC policies configured following the principle of least privilege, with no overly permissive ClusterRoleBindings granting cluster-admin to default or user-facing service accounts (CIS 5.1.1)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Assess RBAC policies for least privilege adherence

items.question: Is the automounting of service account tokens disabled by default (automountServiceAccountToken: false) in namespace-level defaults and pod specifications, requiring explicit opt-in when workloads need API access (CIS 5.1.2)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Auto-check default service account token automounting is disabled

items.question: Are Pod Security Standards (PSS) enforced across all namespaces using Pod Security Admission (PSA) labels, with production namespaces set to "restricted" or "baseline" at the enforce level (CIS 5.2.1)?
items.expectedEvidence: Namespace labels showing pod-security.kubernetes.io/enforce: restricted (or baseline) across production namespaces, and PSA configuration demonstrating cluster-wide defaults.
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify Pod Security Standards enforcement on namespaces

items.question: Are privileged containers prohibited across all workloads in production namespaces, and are containers required to run as non-root with a read-only root filesystem where possible (CIS 5.2.2)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Auto-check privileged containers and root execution are blocked

items.question: Are default-deny NetworkPolicies applied to all namespaces for both ingress and egress traffic, ensuring workloads cannot communicate unless explicitly permitted by policy (CIS 5.3.1)?
items.expectedEvidence: Default-deny NetworkPolicy YAML applied to namespaces, and namespace listing showing all production namespaces have the default-deny policies applied.
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify default-deny NetworkPolicies across namespaces

items.question: Are NetworkPolicies configured to restrict pod-to-pod communication to only necessary traffic flows, and are they regularly reviewed and updated as workload communication requirements change (CIS 5.3.2)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Assess NetworkPolicy granularity and maintenance process

items.question: Are Kubernetes Secrets encrypted at rest using the EncryptionConfiguration resource with a KMS provider or strong encryption algorithm, and are secrets not stored in plain text in etcd (CIS 5.4.1)?
items.expectedEvidence: EncryptionConfiguration showing KMS or aescbc/aesgcm provider for secrets, and verification command output confirming secrets are encrypted in etcd.
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify Kubernetes Secrets are encrypted at rest

items.question: Are external secrets management solutions (e.g., HashiCorp Vault, AWS Secrets Manager, Azure Key Vault) integrated via CSI Secret Store Driver or External Secrets Operator to avoid storing sensitive data directly in Kubernetes Secret objects (CIS 5.4.2)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Confirm external secrets management integration

items.question: Are resource quotas and limit ranges defined for all namespaces to prevent resource exhaustion attacks (CPU/memory bombs) and ensure fair resource allocation across workloads (CIS 5.7.1)?
items.expectedEvidence: ResourceQuota and LimitRange objects applied to production namespaces, showing CPU, memory, and pod count limits.
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify resource quotas and limit ranges on namespaces

items.question: Are namespaces used to provide logical isolation between different teams, applications, and environments, with RBAC, NetworkPolicies, and ResourceQuotas scoped per namespace (CIS 5.7.2)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Assess namespace-based isolation strategy and implementation
